Lower Extremity Analysis Help


This data has been extracted from the Definitive Healthcare database.

It is Medicare’s policy not to provide a claim count for procedures that have 10 or fewer patients. For these procedures, the value of the claim total is provided, but not the number of patients who involved.

DRG codes

470: Major joint replacement or reattachment of lower extremity W/O MCC (without major complication and/or comorbidity)

469: Major joint replacement or reattachment of lower extremity W MCC (with major complication and/or comorbidity)

468: Revision of hip or knee replacement W/O CC/MCC (without complication and/or comorbidity/ major complication and/or comorbidity)

467: Revision of hip or knee replacement W CC (with complication and/or comorbidity)

466: Revision of hip or knee replacement W MCC (with major complication and/or comorbidity)

 

Est total # claims

This includes private payer (estimated), Medicare and Medicaid claims

 

Est total payments

This is the amount paid to the hospital after negotiated discounts have been applied. The charge submitted by the hospital to the payer is much higher.

 

Readmission rate

This is based on Medicare data only and produced by CMS.

The calculation is based on qualifying claims (there are a number of exclusions including: patients with an incomplete Medicare history, discharge takes place at the end of the period and any readmission would be in the next period etc).

A zero means there were no admissions (numerator=0). A blank field means there are no qualifying claims (denominator=0).

 

Readmission rate rank

This is based on Medicare data only. Ranking is based on percentiles; a rank of 99 is best.

 

Average LOS

This is the average length of stay and is based on Medicare data only.

 

Veterans Health Administration Hospitals

There is limited data available for VA hospitals. Approximately 50% of veterans enrolled in the VA Healthcare System are eligible for Medicare.

 

Ambulatory Surgery Center

We do not currently subscribe to the Definitive Healthcare ASC database.

 

Kaiser Permanente

This hospital system provides the legal minimum data to CMS and therefore you will see some gaps.

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
Medicare Readmission Reduction Penalty Score Help


The Medicare Readmission Reduction Program provides financial incentives to hospitals to reduce costly and unnecessary hospital readmissions.

The Excess Readmission Ratio is calculated by measuring the ratio of predicted to expected readmissions:

• Predicted - the number of readmissions predicted based on the hospital performance with its observed case mix.

• Expected - the number of readmissions expected based on average hospital performance with a given hospital’s case mix.

 

A ratio greater than 1 indicates excess readmissions.

 

For Medicare, a hospital readmission happens when a patient is admitted to a hospital within 30 days, and includes readmissions to any hospital, not just where the patient was originally hospitalized. It doesn’t include certain planned readmissions.

 

The overall gain / penalty is the percentage of reimbursement that CMS will withhold in that fiscal year. The maximum is 3%.

 

It is based on six measures:

• Acute myocardial infarction

• Heart failure,

• Pneumonia

• Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease

• Hip/knee arthroplasty

• Coronary artery bypass

 

Hip and Knee arthroplasty have only been included in the Readmission Reduction Penalty Score since 2015.

 

The score for each fiscal year is based on the following data ranges:

 

2017 1 July 2012 - 30 June 2015

2018 1 July 2013 - 30 June 2016

2019 1 July 2014 - 30 June 2017

2020 1 July 2015 - 30 June 2018

 

In a few cases there is a penalty adjustment shown but no revenue adjustment. This is because the hospital is part of a group and the revenue adjustment is being processed through the lead hospital.

 

 

Veterans Health Administration Hospitals

There is limited data available for VA hospitals. Approximately 50% of veterans enrolled in the VA Healthcare System are eligible for Medicare.

 

Ambulatory Surgery Center

We do not currently subscribe to the Definitive Healthcare ASC database.

 

Kaiser Permanente

This hospital system provides the legal minimum data to CMS and therefore you will see some gaps.
